Wow, Frank. Are you the federal government lacky sent in to debunk the videos, or are you that stupid on your own? "Russians enticed American fighter pilots to turn on their radar." I can tell you from first hand knowledge pilots turn on equipment unless there is a restrictive EMCON condition, and I doubt that was the case off the American West Coast. I bet every system was ON except the weapons release button. Fire control radar and other optics are nearly always ON unless training exercises prohibit or other conditions are set by battle commanders. They are always operational or the aircraft doesn't leave the ship. Bracketing a target is not an offensive weapons system, but an internal control feature, and thus, changed nothing emanating from our aircraft. Furthermore, a guided-missile cruiser tracked the objects using their SPY1-A radar, and I can tell you with certainty, that system is amazing. So when they said they see contact, it's there. That system can detect what many others cannot and with great reliability. I believe all the reporting stations and not you, Frank.

Consider that the military in general and fighter jet pilots more specifically, are not generally privy to work performed by DARPA (Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency). They are if you'll pardon the expression, at some level of grunt; low, medium, or high but grunt nonetheless.

Quantum mechanical physicists long ago postulated the kinds of Newtonian "impossibilities" we're hearing about now. If some of it has indeed attained fruition and reached testability, then the grunts are going to log and catalog their observations as UFOs.

Here's a decade old, short but dense NASA introduction to Quantum Vacuum as a means of propulsion:

"... the idea of a “quantum ramjet drive” was proposed by Arthur C. Clark (proposer of geosynchronous communications satellites in 1945) in the book Songs of Distant Earth in 1985: “If vacuum fluctuations can be harnessed for propulsion by anyone besides science fiction writers, the purely engineering problems of interstellar flight would be solved.”  When this question is viewed strictly classically, the answer is clearly no, as there is no reaction mass to be used to conserve momentum. However, Quantum Electrodynamics (QED), which has made predictions verified to 1 part in 10 billion, also predicts that the quantum vacuum (lowest state of the electrodynamic field) is not empty, but rather a sea of virtual particles and photons that pop into and out of existence stemming from the Heisenberg uncertainty principle."

You couldn't get any kind of MIT genius to look at chromatographs of Martian dirt, he would be 100% trying to get on a jet and fly around the coast of California 24/7.

Don't forget. In the early 1940's there were reports of an airplane without a propeller being flown at blazing speeds piloted by a gorilla wearing a top hat and smoking a cigar.

Turns out it was a test pilot named Jack Woolams, while flying the still unknown experimental P59 jet airplane, he would join formation with unsuspecting pilots flying propeller-driven fighters and to their surprise, wave at them while wearing a gorilla mask, a bowler hat and of course smoking a cigar, then speeding away leaving the confused pilots behind.  So convincing was the act that many a pilot who reported the incident spent some serious time with the base psychologist who was doing research into hallucinations caused by flying airplanes.

The smartest and most honest person I've ever met once saw something that he described as a craft that defied everything we know about Physics. He saw it forty years ago.

This is a man who the president of Caltech called "the smartest man I've ever met". 

Why is this important? The man was in charge of all of NASA's unmanned spaceflight. He was at NASA from the very start, working in a dirt field that would eventually become Jet Propulsion Laboratory. The man spent 35 years at the lab.

In retirement, he was a contractor for Skunkworks. The man had the reputation, smarts and the credentials to know that whatever he saw was beyond our capabilities.

UFO fans would have us believe that aliens come from light years away -- yes, to our planet, even though their existence would mean there are countless other inhabited planets they could just as easily visit -- these aliens take the time and trouble to come HERE.  They have been visiting here for decades if not going back thousands of years, if you believe, "Ancient Aliens."  But despite allowing themselves to be seen -- and photographed and taped (although never quite enough to prove they exist) -- and despite allegedly abducting earthlings -- they never land, they never introduce themselves, and they seem to have no purpose.  Are they simply here to study and observe?  You would think that beings that advanced would be able to wrap up their study pretty quickly.  Proof that they are indeed from another planet or dimension is always just out of reach -- so despite teasing us with appearances, they obviously don't want to actually contact us.  They aren't hostile and they aren't friendly.  None of this makes any sense at all if they are highly advanced beings.  But there is one thing that does make sense:  We are not being visited by beings from another planet, another dimension, or another time.  Even if you believe there must be life on other planets, none of those beings have come here.
